data.description: The 2026 Summer Internship Program will run from May 18, 2026, through August 7, 2026. Candidates must be available to start on May 18 and participate through the duration of the program. Who Are We?    The Toro Company (TTC) has delivered market-leading, innovative products and outstanding customer care for more than 100 years. With over 11,000 employees worldwide, TTC is headquartered in Bloomington, Minnesota, USA.  Our company designs and manufactures turf maintenance equipment; turf irrigation systems; landscape and lighting products; snow and ice management solutions; agricultural irrigation systems; rental, specialty and underground construction equipment; and residential turf and snow equipment. We market and sell TTC products worldwide through a network of distributors, dealers, mass retailers, hardware retailers, equipment rental center and home centers—as well as online direct to end users.  What Will You Do? As an Enterprise Insights Analyst Intern, you will play a key role in advancing analytics initiatives that support The Toro Company’s diverse portfolio of brands. With a curious, proactive mindset, you will partner with cross‑functional teams to advance economic forecasting, customer insights, and AI‑driven analysis. Your work will transform complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive meaningful business improvements and enterprise-level impact.This role is ideal for a student who is passionate about data storytelling, motivated by solving business challenges, and eager to build real‑world consulting and analytics skills.In order to grow and build a successful career with The Toro Company, you will be responsible for:  Assisting in data storytelling using economic forecasting data sourced from both internal systems and external market indicators.Leveraging AI and machine learning tools to support customer persona development, market research, and early‑stage product concept testing.Analyzing customer insights, segmentation datasets, surveys, and behavioral trends to uncover opportunities and guide decision‑making.Support the creation of dashboards and visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Excel, or similar platforms.Translate complex datasets into clear, actionable recommendations for business partners, including senior leadership. What Do You Need? To be considered for this role, an individual should meet the following minimal requirements: Education: Currently pursuing a degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, Marketing Analytics, Finance, or a related field.Skills: Strong data analytics and critical-thinking abilities. Proficiency in Excel (including pivot tables, formulas and charts). Experience with at least one BI or analytics tool—such as Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Python, or R—is a plus.Coursework or experience in forecasting, econometrics, or predictive analytics.Familiarity with AI tools (e.g., text analytics, machine learning basics, automation tools). Exposure to market research or customer insights.Characteristics: Collaborative and team‑oriented working style.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Ability to work independently while contributing effectively in group settings.Demonstrates initiative and takes ownership of tasks.Operates with a solution‑oriented and analytical mindset. What Can We Give You?    At The Toro Company, we are always working to make sure our interns know just how valued they are. In addition to a competitive pay- The Toro Company offers interns a variety of perks, including:  Dress for your day – We know you're more productive when you're comfortable, which is why TTC employees are encouraged to take advantage of our casual, corporate environment. Volunteerism – The Toro Company is proud to provide interns 8 hours of paid time to volunteer in the community. Summer Hours *Based on Location* – Enjoy a flexible schedule during the summer! By working a little more during the first few days of the week, TTC employees at certain locations are able to start their weekends early and leave by noon on Friday. Competitive Pay – anticipated pay range $22.00-$33.00 per hour.  If you’re interested in this position but don’t meet every single qualification, still please consider applying. We value potential, the ability to learn quickly, and diverse perspectives. The Toro Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider all qualified applicants based on merit and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military service, or other non-merit factors. We are committed to creating a welcoming environment for all employees.
requirements: Currently pursuing a degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, Marketing Analytics, Finance, or a related field.
responsibilities: Leveraging AI and machine learning tools to support customer persona development, market research, and early‑stage product concept testing.
